title: Inside L.A. County sheriff's dubious corruption probe of Sheila Kuehl, another watchdog
dc:creator: Michael Finnegan, Laura J. Nelson
description: The L.A. County Sheriff's Department opened a bribery probe of two of its own watchdogs in what critics of Sheriff Alex Villanueva call an abuse of power.
content:encoded: The L.A. County Sheriff's Department opened a bribery probe of two of its own watchdogs in what critics of Sheriff Alex Villanueva call an abuse of power.

media:content.media:description: SANTA MONICA, CA - SEPTEMBER 14, 2022 - - Los Angeles County sheriffs escort Los Angeles Supervisor Shelia Kuehl's from her house after serving her an early morning search warrant in Santa Monica on September 14, 2022. This was part of a criminal investigation into a county contract awarded to a nonprofit organization. Sheriff's investigators also searched Patti Giggans' house, her nonprofit's offices, officers at the L.A. County Hall of Administration and the headquarters of the county's Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which awarded a contract to Giggans' Peace Over Violence." (Genaro Molina / Los Angeles Times)
